summary:
Business-technology specialist experienced in organizing and leading teams to design, build, and deliver high-value sales and marketing solutions. My experience spans three years with The Heineken Company in Europe and Africa. Through various roles, my core responsibility was to bridge the gap between developers and the sales/marketing teams. My deep knowledge of both the business and technical perspectives allowed teams to work together more quickly and efficiently, and ultimately enabled us to deploy higher-quality solutions to our customers. Specific project details can be found in the Experience section of this LinkedIn page. 

In late 2021, after over seven years abroad, I decided it was time to move back to the U.S. I left my job at Heineken, and moved home to pursue my own business venture: real estate investment. Currently, I own and operate a small portfolio of rental properties in Pennsylvania and New York. 

Personally, I enjoy traveling, meeting new people, spending time with friends and family, and the outdoors. I love to ski, both on snow and water, as well as ice skate (I'm a big hockey fan). I also enjoy reading, exercising, and other activities that contribute to health and growth! 

A few fun facts about me: 1) I've lived on four continents. 2) I played ice hockey for 14 years before moving to Brazil (no ice there!). 3) I once caught a piranha with a bamboo fishing pole (and survived). 

Want to know more? Let's have a virtual coffee! I look forward to connecting.

profile_positions.description:
MEGA Properties owns and operates a portfolio of rental properties in Pennsylvania and New York State, including single-family homes and short-term rental vacation properties (e.g. Airbnb/VRBO). 

As CEO, I am responsible for all day-to-day operations as well as long-term strategic planning. Core activities include: maintaining a pipeline of leads to convert into new acquisitions, property analysis, financial analysis, market research, studying macroeconomic trends that may affect home values, managing tenants, managing employees, and much more.
profile_positions.title: Founder & CEO

profile_positions.description:
As Product Architect, I was part of the Heineken Digital & Technology (D&T) department but functionally embedded within the Commerce team. In this role, I was the technology expert and partner to my colleagues in Marketing with a specific focus on global Smart Creative solutions. 

What is Smart Creative? Simply put, it's data-driven marketing. Instead of showing the same advertisement (i.e. the creative piece) to everyone worldwide, we used data to make it "smart". This way, we could target creative ads to consumers based on their interests. For example, if you were a soccer fan, we would show you a World Cup-themed creative. Likewise, if the data showed you prefer seltzer over beer, then we would push a seltzer creative instead.   

My role focused specifically on the ongoing (re)design, testing, implementation, and management of Heineken's global Digital Asset Management (DAM) system, and its place in the wider Heineken architecture. It involved close work with my colleagues in Marketing to understand and document their requirements for the DAM, and then work with our external development partners to build and deploy the solution.

Core activities:
- Launched a complete redesign of the DAM to over 80 countries
- Enhanced DAM capability with on-demand video editing
- Orchestrated complex discussions between over 60 stakeholders, both internally and externally
- Managed external vendors and developers based in Europe and Asia
- Executed user testing and feedback for DAM and other Martech systems
- Budget reporting for DAM
- Maintained a constant customer feedback-and-response loop to troubleshoot issues
- Built a playbook of global Martech solutions currently available
- Managed Heineken's global digital experience platforms (interim)
profile_positions.title: Product Manager - Global Marketing Technology (MarTech)

profile_positions.description:
I joined the Heineken family in 2018 as part of their International Graduate Program (IGP). Each year, the IGP selected a small batch of high-potential recent graduates from all over the world, and jumpstarted their career in Heineken with a two-year traineeship. Each year, participants would receive a new functional assignment and a new destination country. This way, participants were exposed to various jobs within the company while also gaining experience living and working in foreign markets.  

I completed the IGP in 2020, after one year in the Netherlands (headquarters) and one year on assignment in South Africa.
profile_positions.title: International Graduate Program (IGP)

profile_positions.description:
As Business Architect, I was the tech specialist assigned as a part of the Sales Team for Heineken South Africa. In this role, I managed a large project focused on Omni-Channel Enablement (OCE). The objective was to use data to increase revenue by targeting sales rep activities in the field. 

To accomplish this, we brought together dozens of independent data sources, combined them with new data we were receiving from previously dark markets, and centralized it all in a single location. From there, we were able to analyze the sales data from POS devices nationwide in real-time, and send sales reps targeted sales activities. This way, reps could focus their limited time on the customers and outlets that required the most attention, and reduce time waste. The outcome was a significantly more efficient and impactful sales force, higher sales volume, and increased revenue for the company.

Core activities: 
- Connected 12+ fragmented data sources to a single source of truth
- Worked in the field to document user design feedback and improve POS devices
- Updated new POS systems to fix data quality issues
- Built a tool to automate customized sales activities for reps
profile_positions.title: Project Manager: eCommerce & Sales

profile_positions.description: Part-time consultant with the Insights Lab, Heineken's global testing ground for emerging technology, big-data analytics, machine learning, robotics, artificial intelligence, and much more. My role was to assist in formulating business use-cases, run experiments, and then present our findings to senior management. My core project during this time was building a model to better predict global demand trends months in advance, and use that data to adjust brewing schedules.
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant: Advanced Analytics

profile_positions.description:
I spearheaded a project to measure and reduce the prevalence of business-managed information technology, also known as Shadow I.T., within Heineken's global operations. Shadow I.T. refers to the use of I.T. devices, software, and services outside the ownership or control of the I.T. department. It presents a serious security risk to companies large and small, especially as businesses continue to grow more reliant on technology to operate, and data-privacy concerns continue to expand. 

We solved this with a two-prong approach. First, we implemented online safeguards to detect and block shadow I.T. attempts, and redirect employees to either select a pre-approved tool to fit their needs or to a quick security risk assessment to get their tool approved for use. Second, we raised awareness of shadow I.T. and information security best practices in general. This way, employees could be more security-aware in their daily activities.

Core activities:
- Investigated to discover how much and how bad the problem was
- Convinced senior management it was worth investing the time and resources to fix 
- Implemented tool for automated risk assessments of new business tools
- Centralized a database of approved alternatives to suggest when shadow I.T. was detected
- Documented requirements and developed an RFP for a new global security awareness campaign
profile_positions.title: Cybersecurity & Risk Consultant

profile_positions.description: Instructed classes of 60+ undergraduate business students in two separate courses: 1) Mathematics, and 2) Information Technology (I.T.). I gave practical, hands-on experience with the concepts presented during plenary lectures, supported professors in class, and moderated exams. This role required ample preparation, public speaking skills, class management, and a deep understanding of the concepts being taught.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant: Mathematics & Information Technology (I.T.)

company.name: RockBoost - The Dutch Growth Hacking Agency

profile_positions.description:
Worked as part of an agile team of expert "Growth Hackers". Using the newest and most advanced tools and techniques, we worked to help our clients achieve exponential growth. Experience includes Google Analytics, SEO, Google Adwords, SCRUM, Copywriting, Hotjar, MailChimp, Facebook Advertisement, and much more. Furthermore, I was responsible for internal business development and the creation of structured business processes to help scale the company from a small start-up to a scale-up. 

Core activities: 
- Executed digital marketing and analytics audits
- Setup Google Analytics for new clients
- Updated search engine optimization (SEO) for new clients
- Ran A/B tests and experiments 
- Documented or designed business processes
- Standardized business processes
- Managed HR applications, reviews, and first-stage interviews
- Assisted copywriters 
- Led training workshops to students
profile_positions.title: Junior Growth Hacker

profile_positions.company: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
profile_positions.description: As a Program Ambassador for the BSc International Business Administration, my duties revolved mainly around speaking with prospective international students throughout the year. This included answering a wide array of questions related to all aspects of studying and life at RSM and in Rotterdam. This role helped me to further my cross-cultural communication skills, as well as connect with future students from diverse backgrounds.
profile_positions.title: Program Ambassador

profile_positions.description: As a Student Representative for the BS International Business Administration class of 2017, I served primarily as the bridge between students, professors, and program managers. I remained in constant contact with all stakeholders and ensured students had a voice with regard to all aspects of a particular course. This included speaking with students formally and informally, collecting feedback, and in general making sure things ran smoothly. This also included anticipating potential issues/questions and finding an immediate solution. If students had an issue with an exam, I would be responsible for gathering feedback and working with the professor to resolve the situation.
profile_positions.title: IBA Student Representative

profile_positions.description:
The idea was simple: if we could connect the brightest minds from the best universities around the world, and do so at a young age, they could forge meaningful relationships early in life and establish a better foundation for these future leaders to work together, despite their differences, to solve the many complex issues of the world. 

We brought together young people from over 20 countries and provided a common platform to work on causes they were passionate about. Through this organization, students connected with other social actors, entrepreneurs, and like-minded people, and worked together to develop various projects to benefit the community. 

I was responsible for overseeing global operations of the organization, as well as local chapters domestically and abroad. I provided leadership and guidance to fellow board members, advised individual departments on their strategy and direction, and managed relations with external stakeholders. I also led the team in the development and implementation of an international expansion strategy. Notably, this included working closely with chapters in the Netherlands, India, Iran, Italy, the United States, Canada, and Brazil.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder & President

profile_positions.description:
As the IBA Study Manager, I was responsible for all aspects of the tutoring courses offered to BSc IBA students at RSM, Erasmus University. This included recruiting/hiring qualified tutors, planning and coordinating schedules, managing finances, setting prices, marketing, and all other administrative tasks. 

Key takeaways: 
- Online Sales 
- Digital Marketing
- Organizational Management 
- Planning & Coordinating 
- Interview Skills 
- Financial Management
profile_positions.title: IBA Study Manager

profile_positions.description:
I worked at various bars and restaurants across the eastern coast of the United States. These establishments ranged from casual bars to upscale fine-dinning experiences. 

Key takeaways:
- Sales & Upselling
- How to Thrive with Intense Time Pressure
- Time & Task Management
- Attention to Detail 
- Customer Service 
- Public Speaking
- Problem Solving 
- Quick Thinking
profile_positions.title: Server & Bartender

profile_positions.description:
Customer Service and Sales Associate at Lowe's Home Improvement. This included a wide range of tasks, from on-floor sales, customer service, and check-out. The majority of my time was dedicated to speaking with customers, and handling complaints/returns. 

Key takeaways:
- Customer Service 
- Management of Hostile Customers
- Time Management 
- Sales & Negotiation 
- Public Speaking
profile_positions.title: Sales Associate

company.name: International Club, Harrisburg Area Community College

volunteer_experiences.description:
As President of the International Club, it was my responsibility to oversee all departments and operations of the organization. Together with the school, we organized several events to promote our diverse student body and cultural awareness. We also provided an open, safe space for different cultures to meet and socialize. 

Key takeaways: 
- Leadership & Management
- Organization & Planning 
- Critical Thinking 
- Creative Thinking

Senator in HACC Lancaster's Student Government Association. Together, we discussed important student-related issues, and gathered feedback from students to propose changes to the administration. We also hosted events, and provided support to new and struggling students. 

Key takeaways: 
- Teamwork
- Governance
- Negotiation & Compromise 
- Public Speaking

Summer camp for kids aged 5-12. I began as a volunteer at the age of 13 and was later promoted to program coordinator. As coordinator, duties included financial management, activity planning, supervision of kids, staff, and volunteers, and communication with parents and superiors. 

Key takeaways: 
- Planning & Organization 
- Time Management
- Patience
- Childcare
